eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils

Class ValueChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.slipo.athenarc.triplegeo.utils.ValueChecker

  • public class ValueChecker
extends java.lang.Object
    Removes or replaces illegal characters from a literal value. LIMITATIONS: Currently handling only some basic cases that may cause trouble (e.g., line breaks) in literals included in RDF triples.
    Version:
    1.6
    Author:
    Kostas Patroumpas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Pattern> replacements 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ValueChecker()
      Constructs a ValueChecker object that will be used for checking (and possibly correcting) literals for specific anomalies before issuing RDF triples

    • Method Summary

      Find a given pattern (i.e., regular expression) and replace it with another string in a literal.

        public java.lang.String removeIllegalChars(java.lang.String val)
        Eliminates illegal characters from the given string value (literal)
        Parameters:
        val - A string value.
        Returns:
        The same string value with any illegal characters removed.

      • removeDelimiter

        public java.lang.String removeDelimiter(java.lang.String val)
        Eliminates any appearance of the delimiter character in the given string value (literal)
        Parameters:
        val - A string value.
        Returns:
        The same string value after the delimiter character has been replaced.

      • cleanupURL

        public java.lang.String cleanupURL(java.lang.String val)
        Restores the given string value as a URL
        Parameters:
        val - A string value representing a URL
        Returns:
        The same string value as a valid HTTP address

      • replaceWhiteSpace

        public java.lang.String replaceWhiteSpace(java.lang.String val)
        Remove whitespace characters from a string literal
        Parameters:
        val - A string value that possibly contains whitespace
        Returns:
        The original string with any whitespace characters replaced

      • findReplaceSubstring

        public java.lang.String findReplaceSubstring(java.lang.String val,
                                             Pattern p)
        Find a given substring and replace it with another string in a literal.
        Parameters:
        val - A literal value to be searched for the substring.
        p - A pattern specifying a search and a replacement string (specified in the external resource XML file).
        Returns:
        The modified literal after replacement.

      • findReplacePattern

        public java.lang.String findReplacePattern(java.lang.String val,
                                           Pattern p)
        Find a given pattern (i.e., regular expression) and replace it with another string in a literal.
        Parameters:
        val - A literal value to be searched for the pattern.
        p - A pattern specifying a search regular expression and a replacement string (specified in the external resource XML file).
        Returns:
        The modified literal after replacement.
